name: Comfort Inn South Forest Beach

reviews.text: Arrival 27AUG2010, Departure 01SEP2010 5 nt stay.
reviews.title: Budget Minded Hotel

reviews.text: The hotel was just OK. I would have been very depressed if I had paid the rack rate which at the time was close to $100.00nt. I used Priceline and paid $41.00nt. I stayed on the top floor/5 th floor and it was fairly quiet. I paid an additional $10.00day for the convenience of a fridge and microwave. I did notice some rooms on the top floor were crash pads for airline pilots. That probably contributed to the quietness.
reviews.title: Great Place to stay in winter months

reviews.text: I saw many families with kids in tow. I guess it's a good buy for them as compared to the hotels that are directly on the beach which are over $200.00nt. It is a short walk to Coligny Circle and the beach.
reviews.title: Not good for young children

reviews.text: The bed was very comfortable. Overall the hotel could use some updating. Maybe some new furniture and fresh paint would be a great start.
reviews.title: INTERNET is UNUSABLY SLOW! Most frustrating thing ever!!!

reviews.text: I've recently discovered Hilton Head being a New Englander. This was my 3rd visit in 2yrs. It is truly a beautiful location. I applaud the urban planners / zoning board.
reviews.title: dont stay here listen to me

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For an older hotel it was very clean, service excellant, free shuttle to beach and Coligny Plaza, about 2 blocks away. Very nice pool and nice continental breakfast. Only 7 miles from airport. Priced right, We arrived early and were able to get into a room before noon. Will go back!
reviews.title: Great value and service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We moved from a dirty and odoriffic Days Inn to an improved but not great Comfort Inn hotel room. Even though we were charged a premium price of $170, the hotel appears to be old and showing numerous signs of major wear and minimal maintenance, such as a missing safety bar in the tub, the shower curtain rod loose in the wall and on the verge of collapse, but the room was average in cleanliness and comfort. Although the location is very convenient to the beach (across the street and through a public walkway), the separate location of the registration and breakfast area was somewhat inconvenient, but allowed us extra walking past some pleasant areas. The breakfast was usual minimum fare: cereal, juice, coffee, waffles, toast, sweet rolls, bagels and boiled eggs (served cold). At least the eggs were real and whole and not reconstituted egg "patties" frozen and partially thawed. And the coffee was good. We also liked the fresh tasting water from a special dispenser. The desk attendants were friendly with an attitude of helpfulness and cooperation, especially Hestelle (sp?) We would recommend this hotel with qualifications.
reviews.title: Not bad for an older beach hotel

reviews.text: After reading some of the reviews on here and other sites, I was leary about staying here. From the time we checked in until the time we left, everyone was so nice. We had two rooms. Both rooms were roomy, nice and clean.
reviews.title: Nice experience

reviews.text: We booked this hotel thru Hotwire 3 months in advance and paid $103/nite. It was an extra $15/nite for the king size bed and micro/fridge. The room, bedding, furniture was very crisp and clean. The pool was clean, and the staff was very attentive. We had a problem with some noisy kids next door. I told the front desk, and he said that it would be taken care of. It was. The breakfast was 1/2 block walk to the check-in/out building. Always great choices with fresh food and clean tables. Who minds the walk when you can see natural bamboo, egrets and turtles in the pond, in a quiet, peaceful, beautiful setting? The hotel is one block from the beach, but a 3 block walk to the beautiful public beach--cabanas for changing, nice shower facility, old-fashoined swings, etc. Always a shuttle available--he works for tips. We can't wait to go back!
reviews.title: Perfect hotel for our family.

reviews.text: I had an opportunity to stay at this hotel recently and I should say that I travel extensively through out the year. My stay at this hotel was exceptional. The staff not only met my expectations but exceeded it in everyway. From the staff working at the desk who were extremely informative to the house keeping staff who will go out of their way to ensure a quality stay.
reviews.title: Excellent Stay

reviews.text: The negative things about this hotel are that it is starting to look run down, and I thought the pet fees were excessive. Once you get past those it has some good things to offer. The grounds are nicely kept with plenty of areas for dog walking and it has a large, outdoor, heated pool with a couple of separate picnic areas. Although its on a very quiet street, It is within walking distance of the beach, restaurants, a Tiki Hut, the Visitors' Center and a Bi Lo (walk from the back of the hotel) if you need anything. They serve a typical hotel fare continental breakfast that included hard boiled eggs and waffles. The lobby and breakfast are in a separate building, but it is a short, pleasant walk. It looked like most of the rooms have small balconies (ours did and we appreciated being able to open the door). I got a better rate on-line and was told by the desk that they couldn't match it and to go ahead and made on-line reservations, which, of course, I did. Although the Visitors' Center tried to steer us toward Hilton Head things, we made a trip to Beaufort and took a carriage ride that we thought was wonderful. If you're looking for a plush place to stay this isn't it, but we were fine with it and enjoyed our stay.
reviews.title: Pet Friendly Hotel in Convenient Location

reviews.text: I travel regularly with my husband and two children throughour the Southeast for my my job. I have seen great hotels, poor hotels, and many in between. This will by far be my most memorable experience due to the extreme inconveniences imposed on myself and family. I DEFINATELY expected better from a hotel in Hilton Head, SC. Before I get to the bugs....the check in desk is located in a seperate building from the rooms, so your must either drag, drive, or be "shuttled" with your belongings to the other building. For all you chronic key demagnitizers, this could be a real problem. Breakfast is also served in the other building, but before you decide to stroll down there in the morning, grab your car and find a breakfast other than coffee, poorly made juice, and raisin bran. The rooms also do not come with a microwave or refridgerator...that is additional, a real drag for a person like myself who finds those necessary and generally expects all rooms to come with them. The first night of my stay my husband and I woke up with a few bites on our hands/arms. We thought nothing of it and attributed them to a mosquito. The next night when I got back to the hotel after work I had no additional bites. Knowing we were checking out in the morning, I laid out the next days clothes for all of us and loaded additional things back into the car. I went to bed and woke up an hour later because I felt something biting me. I searched everywhere but did not see anything....I switched beds and went to sleep....when I woke up I had over 60 red swollen itchy bites all over my arms and hands and a few on my legs. Whats worse, is that while I was getting ready for work, putting make-up on etc, things were still biting me, but I COULD NOT SEE THEM. Very scary. Welt after itchy welt appearred...what the heck kind of thing bites your fingers?!?!?! Well, I had to go to work, got dressed and headed down to the other building with my husband to show them my arms and the few bites he got on his wrist. They only said that they would tell "someone." I went to work where I realized I was still getting bitten. My cowowrkers where trying their best not to treat me life a leper. I had my husband arrange for me to go to a walki-in clinic during lunch so I could get some piece of mind. I rushed out to the clinic, they were sooooooo NICE to fit me in right before closing time on a Saturday. The Doctor could not pinpoint what was biting me, but gave me 4, YES FOUR prescriptions to take both orally and topically, and suggested to put everything cloth in the dryer on high heat for a while and quarantine everything else for several days. After my husband dropped me off for work he went back to the Comfort Inn to let them know that I had seen a Doctor and had been written four prescriptions. They said they would let a manager know.....The real nightmare began when we got home and I had to strip the whole family down and rush them in to wash off the "cooties." I spent almost 2 hours unloading the car, seperating the cloth things for the dryer and putting them in plastic bags. I cannot have my toiletries, baby items, car, stroller or anything else for several days as they sit in quarantine. I paid almost $150 to see the doctor, another $120 in prescription medications, and over $200 at the grocery store once I got home to replace necessities I would not be able to use for several days. I won't even go into the frat party going on at the hotel whose members confused the elevators with the trash bins....more to come after I hear back from management.
reviews.title: Bugs.....ewwwww

reviews.text: This hotel is old and appears to be barely holding on. I was in Hilton Head for a timeshare presentation and this is where they sent me. The room itself was fairly clean, but the bathroom's fixtures were loose, have mold and everything is yellowed. They do offer breakfast but I did not eat there. Vacation Play set up the room and they called to tell me "you'll be at a 3 star hotel." Apparently their own rating system starts at 00! The bed was hard, and even though the towels were clean, they were dingy. The best thing to do is wear yourself out so that you're too tired to notice the condition of the room.
reviews.title: This is NOT a 3 star hotel

reviews.text: Old hotel, looks like a prison. Outdated, mold, the bathtub didn't work, toilet always running, bad odor. Stay away!
reviews.title: Terrible Place

reviews.text: The bad:
reviews.title: older hotel needs some work

reviews.text: I enjoyed my stay at this hotel. The room was clean and average size (large for a beach destination). Our room had a balcony, too. Checking in and out we were met with courteous and efficient service, and the included breakfast was fresh and tasty. We plan on staying at this hotel again.
reviews.title: Great service, would visit again

reviews.text: We stayed there from July 2 thru the 9th.We had a large family so we had 2 rooms with connecting doors. The rooms were clean and had plenty of room 2 dbls and a pull out couch. We had fresh towels everyday, nothing of ours was touched by the room cleaning staff. We could walk to the beach and shops within 2 blocks. Before we left I read some of the reviews and some scared us to death. But, I called and talked to the people there and they put any fears we had to rest. This hotel is dog friendly and our room had no sign of fleas or smell. Great Vacation on the Island...
reviews.title: Wonderful experince!

reviews.text: I stayed at this motel while on vacation and was unable to get any rest because of the problems that occurred - told them about the way the electrical socket was arcing sparks they showed me how to use another outlet - they changed the air conditioner out while I was in the room around 11:30pm and the one they replaced it with still did not keep the room cool
reviews.title: Be Careful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would like to thank all that were involved in finding my luggage. Thank you for your outstanding quality and for putting my luggage in the appropriate hands so that it was available once I realized that I had left it. I also want to thank all that were responsible in helpping me to get it back to me in Atlanta, Ga. You have an excellent team of workers, very responsive, and also very reliable. Thank you once again for all you have done and I really enjoyed my stay.
reviews.title: Extraordinary Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We checked in Friday May 21, 2010 . When we walked into the lobby there were 4 employees talking loudly to each other. After a few minutes the lady behind the desk said , " I'll be with you in a minute". Then she preceded to finish her conversation with the other three, laughing and cutting up. Two of them seemed to be security guards the other was an employee getting off of work. Anyway, we listened to the conversation for awhile and she finally turned to check us in.
reviews.title: Unbelievably BAD ! Worst Seen By These Eyes
Loved the location
reviews.text: Nice hotel with friendly reception staff. They were very efficient at check in and our room was spacious with 2 double beds. We overlooked the lake and each morning an alligator popped it's head up and stayed for the day. There were lots of turtles swimming around the lake.
The pool was always clean with plenty of pool towels.
reviews.title: What a DUMP!

reviews.text: We walked to breakfast - it's a short walk - then we walked to the beach for a morning stroll. They no longer take you to the beach on a buggy but have arranged for parking opposite the Holiday Inn so if you are going with children and lots of chairs, there is ample parking there for the day.
reviews.title: Awful

reviews.text: Breakfast was cereals, pastries, toast and fruit. Plenty of hot drinks were available and the buffet was topped up regularly.
reviews.title: Thishotel needs updating!

likes.disliked: — no beach buggy service as promised

reviews.text: We enjoyed the location close to the beach and also enjoyed visiteing Shelter Cove in the evenings - although parking there was always difficult.
reviews.title: Beware

reviews.text: The photos on the website make this place look fresh and modern. When you actually pull up to the place, you're disappointed immediately. The room I stayed in was dark, hadn't been renovated in at least 10 years. Really ugly tacky decor...had this Three's Company vibe to it. The toilet tank lid had a huge crack in it. I thought about checking out, but I was only staying for one night. This fleabag is, at best, a two-star hotel. An upmarket alternative for the hostel crowd.
reviews.title: Blecchhh!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Comfort Inn for one night, March 31, 2007. This is a Comfort Inn, not a luxury hotel, that being said, was nice for what it is. The room was large enough and comfortable. Ours had two Double (not queen) beds and a queen sleeper sofa. There was a table and one chair. There was a dresser with 4 good sized drawers, a nitestand & open closet area. There was a ~27 inch TV with cable, mid-sized fridge, microwave, coffee pot, iron and board, clock/radio, safe with key and internet hookup. There were balconies at each room, but our view was of parking lot and surrounding area, not a bad view, but not the best either.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, good location

likes.disliked: — not on the beach, but then wouldn't be that great price!

reviews.text: The hotel is definitely an older property that has seen upgrades over the years, but it was not too bad. The bathroom is definitely dated. There was a little mold in the caulking at the tub, the only flaw I saw, not unbearable The shower rod is curved, so must have been installed within the last year or two. The sink is outside the bathroom, therefore, someone can shower while someone else uses the sink. The bathroom is small. Towels were adequate and not too thin.
reviews.title: Worst Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This property is not on the beach but only a few blocks away. You can walk down a block or two to the Holiday Inn and reach beach through access there. There are other access points too I am sure. You are also within walking distance of Coligny plaza (shops, restaurants, grocery store, etc.). There are walking paths and sidewalks at the hotel and surrounding areas.
reviews.title: A bit different, but pleasant overall

likes.liked: — The view from the balcony of the lagoon
likes.disliked: — walking to the beach and to continental breakfast

reviews.title: Disappointed, but made whole...
reviews.text: There is a pool, picnic area , bike rack, and nice pond/lagoon area. I saw several turtles sunbathing and alligators are around.

reviews.title: Very basic hotel
reviews.text: The hotel is not much to look at and the rooms are very basic with a tiny bathroom. We tried to talk to the housekeeper about getting an extra pillow but she couldn't speak any English so we finally gave up. The free continental breakfast was also very basic...bagels, toast, juice, coffee. The location was pretty convenient to the beach. The shuttle was nice but does stop at 4PM so we ended up walking back each day. The hotel has a small pool and there is a water park by it but it costs extra and wasn't particularly cheap. We skipped it. If you aren't going to be spending much time in the hotel and you don't expect much extras, the hotel is OK for a couple nights.

This is an inexpensive hotel and it does need some work. The sliding glass door and some room up dating most notably. The room was poorly engineered with the bathroom sink in the short hallway outside the bathroom, and the light to the toilet/shower OUTSIDE the toilet/shower in the hallway.
reviews.title: You get what you pay for here
Great stay - would go back
reviews.text: However, on the plus side...it does have a good location. The room was kept clean. The breakfast at the hotel cafe was very good (skip the free stuff, its priced appropriately), and the staff was friendly and mostly helpful. The pool area was clean and I did enjoy the pool.
If you're used to big fancy rooms at the Marriott then do not stay here. But if what you want is OUTSIDE the hotel room, then you can save a few bucks by staying here.
reviews.title: Comfort Inn not so comforting
Don't Stay at This Hotel
reviews.text: The Comfort Inn is close to the beach, that's about the only plus for this hotel. During my stay at the hotel, my neighbor next door had a dog that barked all night long. I called the front desk, but they didn't do anything about it. I was not able to rest like I truly wanted to. Stay some where else. I looked at this hotel on the web and it was totally different from what I expected. It's old and needs to be refurnished. I'll never stay at this hotel again... even for free! Take my advice... choose another place for you vacation stay on Hilton Head Island.

My husband and I had a wonderful experience at this hotel. Our room was clean, and the staff was very helpful. We especially enjoyed the pool and lagoon surrounding the hotel. The pool had a nice deck overlooking the lagoon. The alligators and turtles in the lagoon were also exciting to watch. The hotel provided a shuttle to the beach, but it was such a short walk that we opted to walk.
reviews.title: Wonderful Experience At Comfort Inn

reviews.text: The few negative things I noticed were the regisration was in a separate building from the main hotel. The continental breakfast was served in this building, so it made for a short walk each morning for breakfast. There was a problem with one of the elevators each day while we were there, so waiting for an elevator was a longer wait. This is an older hotel, so the hallways could use some updating, but the rooms were fine. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.
reviews.title: Did it's job but with few airs and graces.
Itchy red welts
reviews.text: This was my first stay at a Comfort Inn, or any Choice Hotel for that matter following many stays at Hilton, Hyatt, Westin and the ilk so this most likely influences my opinion. I was staying with some friends and they organised the hotels.

The arrangement at this hotel is quite different to the norm with the reception and breakfast area in a separate building some 500ft from the pool and rooms. Arriving at 1pm we were told our room wasn't ready yet so went out for lunch and returned. After checking in we went to the 'living quarters' and were told we had to check-in at another location. We were somewhat confused but it turned out to be a timeshare desk set up within the hotel. Fortunately this was the last run-in with the timeshare people although they appeared to be present in this second lobby area day and night. This lobby area didn't give the best first impression of a hotel as it smelt a tad funny and looked rather grubby and was a flashback to the 1970s in terms of decor. The hotel lift was also pretty rickety and took a day and an age to arrive at all encounters. After a few trips it became obvious it was easier to avoid it altogether and use the stairs.
reviews.title: Nice hotel

aka: Comfort Inn South Forest Beach Hotel Hilton Head
